summary: Manage metadata aliases that resolve back to a canonical source. Helpful when different teams use different nicknames for the same docs.

subcommands.name: alias add
subcommands.description: Attach one or more alternate names to an existing source.

subcommands.name: alias remove
subcommands.description: Detach an alias. Future searches will no longer resolve it automatically.

subcommands.name: alias list
subcommands.description: Show all aliases for the source in text or JSON form.

agent_workflow: Use `alias add` when ingesting docs that have multiple ecosystem names (e.g., `react` vs `reactjs`).
After adjusting aliases, run `blz list --json | jq '.[] | select(.alias=="<canonical>")'` to confirm they persisted.
Remember aliases only affect CLI resolution; storage paths remain tied to the canonical alias.
notes: Alias changes are persisted in the configuration directory under `sources/<alias>.toml`.
Aliases propagate to `blz search` (via `--source`) and the registry resolver.
